House Church at Birmingham Shared Commitments - v.1.1

Completed 12/2023

Preamble: A covenant is "a relationship between two partners who make binding promises to each other and work together to reach a common goal.” The below items and their “fleshing out” came from a series of discussions, open to all folks who participate in the life of our church, throughout 2023. These covenant items are all predicated  by our shared submission to the Holy Spirit and Christ as the head of the church, confessing that Jesus is King & seeking to follow Him.

Items:

  • Shared caring for one another
  • Shared life discernment
  • Shared finances & commitment to generosity
  • Shared gospel proclamation & discipleship
  • Shared seeking of justice & peace
  • Shared turf
  • Shared responsibility for sending/supporting global workers
  • Shared seeking of quick reconciliation with one another

We will emphasize each of these at points throughout the year, on the following Sundays:

  • Shared caring for one another
  • Reflection: Spiritual Gifts Sunday
  • Shared life discernment
  • Reflection: Interdependence Sunday
  • Shared finances & commitment to generosity
  • Reflection: ThanksGIVING Sunday
  • Shared gospel proclamation & discipleship
  • Reflection: Random September Sunday
  • Shared seeking of justice & peace
  • Reflection: Sunday after Martin Luther King, Jr. Day
  • Shared turf
  • Reflection: A springtime (?) Sunday we can try to do together with CCWW or ??
  • Shared responsibility for sending/supporting global workers
  • Reflection: Sunday before GMHC
  • Shared seeking of quick reconciliation with one another
  • Reflection: Peacemaking Sunday

Fleshing Out The Covenant Items:

  1. Shared caring for one another
  1. Commitment to unity- henótēs (from heis, "one") – oneness (unity), especially the God-produced unity (oneness) between believers – i.e. the harmony from sharing likeness of nature with the Lord (used only in Eph 4:3,13)
  1. Abiding by the apostles creed; ok not being from all the same denomination etc., being willing to disagree on some topics while [this sentence is incomplete in the earliest manuscripts :) ]  
  1. 1.Cor 13; love is the foundation where a lot of these other things come about as we are walking through life deeply with each other
  1. Need to be intentional with each other throughout the week & be known by each other well
  1. Submission to one another
  1. Shared life discernment
  1. Vulnerability in asking for the church to speak into each other's lives, especially in big decisions but also being transparent in smaller things too, desiring a blessing of the body
  2. Can happen in specific meetings with the whole body, sometimes just with a few people that can understand and discern best
  3. Choosing a group that will be diligent in prayer over said things with each other
  4. Processing with the group instead of just deciding on your own you're doing x
  1. Shared finance/ commitment to generosity
  1. No needy amongst us, providing for one another
  1. Desire for people to be able to come forward with needs
  1. Financial giving (no set definition, looks different for families)
  1. No overhead cost, so able to give away all income
  2. Giving to overseas workers, neighbors as a body versus just individuals
  1. Rough goal with our income: ⅓ to membercare; ⅓ to neighborhood; ⅓ to overseas
  1. Transparent in regularly sharing this
  1. Shared gospel proclamation & discipleship
  1. Commitment within the church & outside
  1. Meeting throughout the week to study & share scripture
  2. Identifying & utilizing individuals spiritual gifting
  1. Commitment to advancing the kingdom
  1. Speaking about God into the world
  1. By word & deed
  2. Asking each other to hold us accountable to this
  1. Commitment to disciple making & discipleship
  1.  Personal transformation will happen by the holy spirit
  1. Sunday gatherings currently are more geared towards the edifying the body to then go out throughout the week
  1. Have a relationship with someone prior to inviting them to check out Sunday gatherings
  1. Shared seeking of justice & peace
  1. Seeking this amongst our own body along with our neighborhoods, city & beyond
  2. Scripture:
  1. Romans 12:18-19 If it is possible, as far as it depends on you, live at peace with everyone. Do not take revenge, my dear friends, but leave room for God’s wrath, for it is written: “It is mine to avenge; I will repay,” says the Lord.
  2. Micah 6:8  And what does the Lord require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly[a] with your God.
  3. Psalm 146: 9The LORD sets prisoners free, 8 the LORD gives sight to the blind, the LORD lifts up those who are bowed down, the LORD loves the righteous. 9 The LORD watches over the foreigner and sustains the fatherless and the widow, but he frustrates the ways of the wicked.
  4. Matthew 5:9 Blessed are the peacemakers
  5. Isaiah 1:16-17 Wash yourselves; make yourselves clean; remove the evil of your doings from before my eyes; cease to do evil, learn to do good; seek justice, rescue the oppressed, defend the orphan, plead for the widow.
  6. Matthew 25:31-46 the sheep & the goats

v. 40 “The King will reply, ‘Truly I tell you, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers and sisters of mine, you did for me.’

  1. Revelation 21: Then I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away, and there was no longer any sea. I saw the Holy City, the new Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride beautifully dressed for her husband. And I heard a loud voice from the throne saying, "Now the dwelling of God is with men, and he will live with them. They will be his people, and God himself will be with them and be their God. He will wipe every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death or mourning or crying or pain, for the old order of things has passed away."
  1. Peacemakers: seeking wholeness
  1. Peace with God
  2. Peace with Others
  3. Peace with the Earth
  1. Being proximate, being willing to be present
  1. Shared turf
  1. Living in proximity, incarnational living amongst the poor and marginalized, in the area that we are serving
  2. There is a historical tie within our body to the west side of Birmingham -- West End, Titusville, etc. -- as of the first writing of this covenant, but shared turf is not limited to these areas.
  3. Also being cognisant that people may not physically live in a house in a certain area, but can still “share turf”
  1. e.g. working in the community, commitment in prayer etc.
  1.  Someone could be committed to a certain community without ever living there and still be a “core” member of the community (in contrast to someone who never had intention to participate in shared discernment/finances/praying for nations and therefore would not be a “core” member)
  1. Shared responsibility for sending and supporting global workers / supporting great commission fulfillment
  1. As a body we desire every nation & tongue to know Jesus

Matthew 28: 18-20

“All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to me. Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, teaching them to observe all that I have commanded you. And behold, I am with you always, to the end of the age.”

                Revelation 7: 9-10

After this I looked, and behold, a great multitude that no one could number, from every nation, from all tribes and peoples and languages, standing before the throne and before the Lamb, clothed in white robes, with palm branches in their hands, and crying out with a loud voice, “Salvation belongs to our God who sits on the throne, and to the Lamb!”

  1. Sending & Supporting defined
  1. Sending can look like faithfully going “overseas” or even to domestic locations with the intention of manifesting Christ among folks who don’t know him.
  2. We anticipate that the decision to be sent out and the details of how/when/where/etc. someone is sent out will come through a process of shared discernment.
  3. We have a particular desire to connect with people and communities who are unlikely to otherwise encounter Christ followers. However we don’t intend to exclude other locations and peoples.  
  4. We have a defined multi-tiered giving framework that describes our commitments in various situations.
  1. Shared Seeking of Quick Reconciliation With One Another
  1. We affirm the reconciliation process described in Matthew 18.
  2. We acknowledge that one helpful Matthew 18 based tool is Peace Pursuit

* Covenant Definition Source: Bible Project
